thread.title: Prize draw terms and conditions: win 2016 Ryder Cup tickets
thread.title_full: Prize draw terms and conditions: win 2016 Ryder Cup tickets - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Prize draw terms and conditions: win 2016 Ryder Cup tickets
text: Read more about the business of sport 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), Standard Life Investments Limited and Standard Life Employee Services Limited (together “Standard Life”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. Entries must be submitted via www.telegraph.co.uk/busofsport and entry is restricted to one per person. Once submitted, entries cannot be amended in any way. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’s name and county can be obtained by sending a sae to Standard Life Investments Prize Draw Winner, Telegraph Create, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by midnight on Sunday, November 29, 2015. 6. The winner will be contacted within seven days of the closing date of the prize draw. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. 8. One winning entrant will win a pair of General Admission Tickets to The Ryder Cup 2016, which takes place at Hazeltine National Golf Club, Minnesota, United States from September 30 to October 2, 2016. Departing from London on September 29 and returning October 3, 2016, the prize comprises: • Two General Admission tickets to The Ryder Cup, valid for all three days of the competition; • Two return economy class flights from London to Minneapolis Saint Paul; • Four nights in the Hilton Bloomington Hotel, or equivalent level, based on two people sharing a twin or double room on a room only basis; and • Return coach transfers to Hazeltine National Golf Club. 9. The winner and their guest must be available to travel between September 29 and October 3, 2016. Flight and transfer times will be specified and failure to make specified times will result in the winner having to source alternative travel arrangements at their own expense. 10. The prize must be taken as one package and the winner and their guest must travel together. 11. The prize does not include travel between the winner’s home and London, travel insurance, personal expenditure, food and drink or incidental costs, other than where mentioned. It is the responsibility of the prizewinner to ensure they have a valid passport and travel insurance and obtain any necessary vaccinations and visas for their trip 12. The prize is subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 13. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of the Promoter and Standard Life. 14. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 15. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 16. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility of Standard Life. 17. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT.
